physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a group of male students in uniforms. All of them have headgear on and some of them are wearing shorts with long socks. A number of musical instruments can be seen, such as the trombone, trumpet, and drums. ‘Soerabaja’ and ‘Blass Muziek’ are stated on the banner to the left . The background of the phootgraph shows drapings on the walls as well as leaf drapings.
sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows a group of young men from the Tiong Hwa Hway Kwan Student Band. They are each holding an instrument and dressed in uniform. Standing partially outside the frame is a fringed banner, with the words ‘Soerabaja’ and ‘Blass Muziek’ (wind music) visible. 

The Tiong Hwa Hwe Koan was founded in 1900 by a group of Chinese businessmen and journalists and aimed to promote the customs and language among the Indies Chinese. The first Tiong Hwa Hwe Koan Chinese school was established a year later.
title_text: Photograph of Tiong Hwa Hway Kwan Student Band
subject_terms_1: group portraits bands (ensembles) music (performing arts) students
